required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ProChondrix® CR Articular Cartilage Restoration Evaluation (PACE) Registry
clinical_study.official_title: ProChondrix® CR Articular Cartilage Restoration Evaluation (PACE) Registry

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this registry is to obtain long-term outcomes on ProChondrix CR in cartilage repair procedures of the knee, ankle, foot and hip.

detailed_description.textblock:
This multi-center, observational registry will be used to evaluate the effectiveness of ProChondrix CR in patients who undergo treatment for an articular cartilage defect in the knee, ankle, foot or hip.
This registry will be performed at up to 30 clinical sites across the United States.
Patient follow-up will occur following an articular cartilage repair procedure in which the patient receives ProChondrix CR. During this follow-up period, each patient will be evaluated at least four (4) times at: 3, 6, 12 and 24 months after surgical intervention and will continue annually for as long as patients are willing to fill out questionnaires and outcomes assessments up to 10 years post operatively.

primary_outcome.description: Obtain long-term results on patients who have undergone an articular cartilage repair procedure using ProChondrix CR, as assessed by patient reported outcomes.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Articular Cartilage Defect of the Knee
arm_group.description: Patients, who undergo an articular cartilage repair of the knee using ProChondrix CR.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Articular Cartilage Defect of the Ankle
arm_group.description: Patients, who undergo an articular cartilage repair of the ankle using ProChondrix CR.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Articular Cartilage Defect of the Foot
arm_group.description: Patients, who undergo an articular cartilage repair of the foot using ProChondrix CR.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Articular Cartilage Defect of the Hip
arm_group.description: Patients, who undergo an articular cartilage repair of the hip using ProChondrix CR.

intervention.description: Patient reported outcomes will be collected on patients who have had a cartilage repair procedure using ProChondrix CR in the knee, hip, foot or ankle.
intervention.arm_group_label: Articular Cartilage Defect of the Ankle
Articular Cartilage Defect of the Foot
Articular Cartilage Defect of the Hip
Articular Cartilage Defect of the Knee

study_pop.textblock: Patients, who diagnosed by their treating physician, have a cartilage defect in the knee, ankle, foot or hip that requires surgical intervention utilizing ProChondrix CR.

facility.name: Rocky Mountain Foot and Ankle Center
